title: Business Analyst
description:
JD for Mainframes Business Analyst –

4-6 years of strong working experience as a business analyst for a product development team.

Knowledge of Payroll domain, Taxation in specific is a plus.
Proven experience in working with complex projects.
Working experience on SQL and Mainframe CICS screens.
Strong problem solving & analytical skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Proficient in MS Word
Self-starter should be able to work with minimal supervision in addition to being a strong team player.
Experience/Ability to communicate ideas well and convince people about the same.
Experience/Ability to discuss and review strategies/plans with all the team members.
Willingness/Commitment to be open, agile and contribute as an individual contributor.
Willingness/Commitment to work with highly demanding project teams.
Willingness/Commitment to work through uncertainties to deliver things.
Willing to adapt to sudden changes based on seasonal volumes.
Experience/knowledge on agile projects (SCRUM or similar flavor) will be added plus.




Profile Description:

Owns up the functional analysis of the statutory changes made by various US agencies and translate them into product specific requirements.
Deliverables include detailed analysis documents that maps the agency requirements to product requirements
Responsible for high quality deliverables on-time.
Great eye for detail.
Keeps up-to-date on emerging techniques
Works with highly demanding teams due to the nature of function, compliance.
Identifies, plans and works on improvement areas for self and team.
Builds rapport and communicates with the statutory analysts for discussing the challenges.
Communicates the status update and risks on tasks (self and related team) to the project management.
Must be able to work well under pressure and have a strong understanding of business process, organizational readiness and change management
